Description: The customer requests new features, and developers are ready to implement them without agreeing with management.
More time is needed to complete the next deliverable of the project.
The time to complete the next deliverable was too short and some details were incomplete.
It is not possible to complete planned activities under the agreed budget
The company must find funds to cover the excess costs.
The client is pointing out a new feature that was listed in the initial analysis of needs but was not properly prioritised.
Different requirements in a specification are in conflict. The client wants open access but protected content.
The QA team forgot to conduct the performance test of the software. In fact, it was not planned at all.
The work description is incomplete. Several important features were not described, and some unnecessary functionalities were already completed.
Lead developer decided to show off his skills by adding mushroom picking functionality to the login screen. The customer is shocked.

Mitigation: MT06, MT12, MT19, MM19, MM06, MM18
Description: Task durations are too long and make progress monitoring complicated.

Mitigation: MT01, MT02, MT05, MT07, MT16, -MT17, MC03
Description: The user changes his mind after the major demonstration of the project outcome and introduces new (actual) needs
Before the important presentation of project outcomes, the service did not work.
Modules used in the current project were created ten years ago. Nobody knows where the module documentation is.
Engineers suggest developing features that are out of scope.
The service that sounds innovative at the beginning of the project is outdated by the end of the project.
Two team members fell in love at the beginning of the project. Now, the relationship is breaking apart. A fight between them starts to have a negative impact on the team’s performance.
One team member blames others for not sorting the garbage. He threatens to throw the contents of the trash cans on the desks of his colleagues.
One key staff member got a very generous proposal from your competitor. If she leaves, she takes with her some important know-how and information.
Most team members have a tendency to start their tasks as late as possible.
Team members tend to find and complete some random activities that have very little connection with the project.
Some upcoming tasks require skills that no team member currently has.
Project meetings are so frequent and long that team members lack time to complete tasks.
The client is not providing feedback on previously completed deliverables.
The work from different projects heavily overloads most team members.
A project manager selects team members based on ethnic and cultural preferences. Having the required skills is a secondary option.
The project manager distributes work and resources based on gender preferences. Having the skills needed and results is an irrelevant option.
The project objective is not in accordance with the organisation's strategic objectives. It is a nice job, but do we really need this?
Everything is cool! The project manager doesn't see conflicts. When they are self-evident, they are solved by doing nothing but waiting until they disappear. That takes some time.
You have a message to a colleague from another team. You are not allowed to communicate directly but through your team leads and project manager. That takes ages.
The local community is not happy about the project you are working on. You do not care because they are not your client nor end users of the service.
Two team members are constantly fighting to promote their design ideas and get recognition from the manager.
Journalists discovered that your project management system hotline is used for drug trafficking. Yunior QA is a drug dealer.
External vendor fails with the delivery
The client of the project goes bankrupt. Game Over!
Customer organisation was restructured. Previous contact persons are moved to different departments, and new contacts know little about the project.
A long-time partner is bankrupt, and all previously developed major supply channels must be revised.
The customer requests multiple changes to the initial product design but finally selects the first (initial) one.
Economic experts predict a continued rise in energy prices, making production more expensive.
The client refuses to pay for some deliverables agreed upon in the project plan and contract.
The language of the client contract is so complicated that the terms of service can be interpreted in many ways.
The client contract does not specify after-project maintenance terms. The client expects maintenance to be part of the contract. The provider expects to sign a new contract.
One of the two companies that made the project proposal together feels that the partner is not contributing at the agreed-upon level.
One partner is following a waterfall strategy to lead the project, and the other is implementing agile methods.
Inflation has increased all project costs.
Several staff members have joined the Rise Against the Machines movement. They are threatening to destroy the work equipment.
The local parliament plans to accept a new law requiring international staff members to speak the local language at the B2 level.
The company’s web page was hacked, and hackers are threatening to upload some pornographic materials.
Workers who left the company started offering services similar to your company. Several loyal customers are threatening to leave.
A competitor comes out with a similar product first.
Competitors are constantly increasing the salaries of their staff.
Competitors are bidding their project offers for a price that can barely cover production costs.
Somebody has hacked and blocked your project management information system. Now they ask 999 Bitcoins to unblock it.
The company's information systems are blocked by a flood of emails about winning the Nigerian lottery.
The AI bubble exploded, and the economy is going downhill again. Nobody is interested in starting a new project, and existing clients are having financial difficulties.
Many team members finally had enough of low salaries, stereotypical attitudes, bad weather, and bad food in this country. They are planning to emigrate to Russia, wherever is better.
A new plague breaks out and forces all staff members to work from home.
Some features of your product conflict with national regulations, and the customer's association is starting a lawsuit against your company
Strong national currency makes local production costly and service price too high on the international market.
One populist party's election promise is to establish a 6-hour workday.
The union demands a 4-day work week for employees.
The union demands a pay rise for all employees.
Copywriters used AI to create content, but now, one publisher is suing you for plagiarism and stealing their work.
Aliens attack the Earth, so continuing with the current project is rather pointless. Game over!
The time-space continuum collapses, and you travel back in time at the beginning of the project. Restart the game.
